member.summary: Utility factory class which creates ICustomRenderSettings objects

member.name: M:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.CustomRenderSettingsUtil.CreateQuantileCustomRenderSettings(EGIS.ShapeFileLib.RenderSettings,System.Drawing.Color[],System.String)
member.summary: Creates an ICustomRenderSettings object which renders shape colors using quantiles

remarks.para: QuantileCustomRenderSettings are used to render individual shape colors in a shapefile layer according to a specified range of values. For example, the color of the rendered shape could be green if field1 is between 0 and 100, yellow if field 1 is between 100 and 200, or red if it is greater than 200.

member.param: The colors used for each quantile. If 5 colors are used then 5 quantiles will be setup
The field name to use for the quantiles

member.name: M:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.CustomRenderSettingsUtil.CreateRandomColorCustomRenderSettings(EGIS.ShapeFileLib.RenderSettings,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an ICustomRenderSettings object which renders shapes with a random color
member.param: The shapefile's RenderSettings object
Random seed used to create the colors. By supplying a seed the same colors will be used when rendering the shapefile in successive drawing operations

member.name: T:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.QuantileRenderSettings
member.summary: QuantileCustomRenderSettings implements the ICustomRenderSettings interface and is used to provide dynamic render settings.

remarks.para: QuantileCustomRenderSettings is used to render individual shape colors in a shapefile layer according to a specified range of values. For example, the color of the rendered shape could be green if field1 is between 0 and 100, yellow if field 1 is between 100 and 200, or red if it is greater than 200.

member.name: T:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.ICustomRenderSettings
member.summary: The ICustomRenderSettings allows applying custom render settings to a shapefile layer
member.remarks: By setting an ICustomRenderSettings object on a shapefile's RenderSettings, you can gain full control over whether indivdual shapes should be rendered and the color to use when rendering the shapes. The ICustomRenderSettings interface also supplies methods to customize any tooltips used by the shapefile layer.

member.name: T:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.DbfWriter
member.summary: a DBF File Writer class
member.remarks:
The DbfWriter class can be used to create or edit a DBF file
The class is used by the ShapeFileWriter class to create new shapefiles. The class can also be used in conjunction with a DbfReader to edit a DBF file by filtering required records or adding/removing new columns

member.param: strign array containing the data for each field in the record

member.name: M:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.DbfWriter.Close
member.summary: Closes the DBF file and the underlying stream used to write the DBF file
member.remarks:
The Close method must be called after all records have been added. This method will update the number of records in the file's main header and outputs the end of file marker to the end of the file.
Failure to call this method will result in an invalid DBF file being generated

member.summary: The point on the poyline closest to the given point

member.summary: The distance from the given point to the polyline

member.name: P:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.PolylineDistanceInfo.PointIndex
member.summary: The zero based point index at the start of the line segment in the poyline closest to the given point
member.remarks: A polyline of N points has (N-1) line segments. PointIndex will be between 0 to (N-2) inclusive.

member.name: P:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.PolylineDistanceInfo.TVal
member.summary: A value between 0..1 indicating the location within the closest line segment

remarks.para:
A TVal of 0 indicates the position on the line segment closest the given point is at the start of the line segment
A TVal of 1 indicates the position on the line segment closest the given point is at the end of the line segment

The TVal property is useful when used with polylines containing measures. For example if Segmentindex is N then the dervied measure at the point on the polyline closest to a given point would be measure[N] + tVal x (measure[N+1] - measure[N])

member.name: T:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.Ellipsoid
member.summary: Simple class that encapsulates the parameters defining an Ellipsoid

remarks.para: Note that in most SPHEROID parameters of the WKT format contained in a ".prj" projection file, the flattening is expressed as 1/f. For example, in SPHEROID["GRS_1980",6378137.0,298.257222101] 1/f = 298.257222101. 6378137.0 is the EquatorialRadius
See remarks on EccentricitySquared for explanation on how to convert "f" to "E^2"

member.name: P:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.Ellipsoid.Id
member.summary: unique Id of the Ellipsoid

member.name: P:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.Ellipsoid.EllipsoidName
member.summary: The well known name of the Ellipsoid

member.name: P:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.Ellipsoid.EquatorialRadius
member.summary: The equatorial radius (semi-major axis) of the ellipsoid

member.name: P:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.Ellipsoid.EccentricitySquared
member.summary: Eccentricity of the Ellipsoid squared
member.remarks:
E^2 is related to the flattening of the Ellipsoid as follows:
E^2 = 1 - (1-f)^2
Note that in most SPHEROID parameters of the WKT format the flattening is expressed as 1/f. For example, in SPHEROID["GRS_1980",6378137.0,298.257222101] 1/f = 298.257222101

member.name: T:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.ShapeFile
member.summary: .NET ShapeFile class used to load, render and query data in an ESRI Shape File. The ShapeFile class is the main class of the EGIS.ShapeFileLib namespace
member.remarks:
The class is designed to open very large shapefiles, providing a low memory implementation which will not load the contents of the shapefile in memory.
The class also provides an option to map the shapefile in memory using native file mapping, which will provide faster rendering speed
NOTE THAT MANY OF THE METHODS IN THIS CLASS ARE NOT THREAD SAFE (due to internal shared buffers). If multiple threads require access to ShapeFile objects then the static (Shared in VB) Sync object should be used to provide mutual access to the shapefiles
An ESRI Shape File consists of 3 files - the ShapeFile index file (.shx), the shape file (.shp) and a DBF file (.dbf). For a more detailed desription of the ShapeFile format consult the ESRI ShapeFile file specification.
Currently supported Shape Types are Point, PointZ, PolyLine, PolyLineM, Polygon and PolygonZ

member.name: M:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.ShapeFile.GetActualExtent
member.summary: Returns the actual ShapeFile Extent in unprojected coordinates
member.remarks: The returned rectanlge is the extent contained in the shapefile's header

member.name: M:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.ShapeFile.GetShapeIndexContainingPoint(EGIS.ShapeFileLib.PointD,System.Double)
member.summary: returns the index of the shape containing Point pt
member.param: The location of the point (in the shapefile's coordinates)
the min distance (in ShapeFile coordinates) between pt and a shape when searching point or line shapes that will return a "hit".
member.returns: zero based index of the shape containing pt or -1 if no shape contains the point
member.remarks:
When searching in a Point ShapeFile a point will be defined as contining pt if the distance between the found point and pt is less than or equal to minDistance
When searching in a PolyLine ShapeFile a Line will be defined as containing the point if the distance between a line segment in the found shape and pt is less than or equal to minDistance

member.name: M:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.DbfReader.GetField(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: returns a string representing the field[fieldIndex] of the Record[recordNumber] in the dbf file Throws ArgumentException if recordNumber ">=" NumberOfRecords or negative, fieldIndex >= FieldCount or negative,
member.param: Zero based record number in the dbf file
Zero based field index in a record
member.returns: the string contents of the required field. Note that the returned string is not trimmed so that if a field length is longer than the stored string then the string is padded with spaces. I.E if a field of length 10 is storing "abc" then the returned string will be padded with 7 space characters

member.name: M:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.DbfReader.GetFields(System.Int32)

member.name: P:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.RenderSettings.PenWidthScale
member.summary: Gets / Sets the width of the pen in ShapeFile coordinate units (PolyLines only).
member.remarks:
This settings is only used when rendering PolyLine or PolyLineM ShapeFiles
If a ShapeFile is using UTM coords this is the width of the lines in metres.
If a ShapeFile is using Lat Long coordinates this is the width of the line in decimal degrees
This property is set automatically when using the Desktop version of Easy GIS .NET, using a default value of 8m for UTM ShapeFiles. For ShapeFiles using Lat Long coordinates, the decimal degree equivalent of the 8m value is calculated based on teh ShapeFiles Extent

member.name: T:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.ShapeFileWriter
member.summary: .NET ShapeFile Writer utility class which provides the ability to create or edit shapefiles from .NET applications.
member.remarks:
ShapeFileWriter is an abstract class. To create an instance of ShapeFileWriter call the CreateWriter method or derive a new class by extending ShapeFileWriter
To use the ShapeFileWriter create a new instance by calling the CreateWriter method, passing in the shapefile path information, shape type and DBF field desricriptions. Progressively call the AddRecord method to add new records to the shapefile. Once all records have been added, close the shapefile by calling the Close method
Deriving classes must overload AddRecord.
IMPORTANT- When you have finished writing all records you must call Close.
All characters stored in DBF records use UTF-8 character encoding to support Unicode character sets

member.name: T:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.TileUtil
member.summary: Utility class with methods to convert Lat Long locations to Tile Coordinates

remarks.para: The TileUtil class is used by the EGIS.Web.Controls TiledSFMap to convert map tile image requests to actual Lat Long position and zoom level for rendering purposes
Note that in order to use Map tiles the property must be set to true

Tiles are organised in a manner similar to the approach used by google maps and bing maps. Each tiles dimension is 256x256 pixels. A tile request is made up of a zoom-level between 0 and 16(inclusive), tile x-ccord and a tile y-ccord. At zoom-level 0 the entire world (-180 lon -> +180 lon) is scaled to fit in 1 tile. At level 1 the world will fit in 2 tiles x 2 tiles, at level 2 the world will fit into 4 tiles x 4 tiles, .. etc.
Tiles are numbered from zero in the upper left corner to (NumTiles at zoom-level)-1 as below:

member.name: M:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.TileUtil.GetTileFromGisLocation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the tile number a given lat/long location lies in at a given zoom level
member.returns: a Point containing the tiles x,y coordinates

member.summary: Converts a zoomLevel to its equivalent double-precision scaling

member.name: M:EGIS.ShapeFileLib.TileUtil.ScaleToZoomLevel(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a double-precision scaling to equivalent tile zoom-level
